se.cbb.jprime.mcmc

Class NormalProposer

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.mcmc.NormalProposer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InfoProvider, Proposer

    public class NormalProposer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Proposer
    Represents a normal proposal distribution. That is, given a current state parameter value m, it draws a new value Y ~ N(m,v). It is also possible to limit the domain to [A,B], (A,inf) and so forth, thus creating a truncated normal distribution.

    The proposer can perturb both singleton parameters and arrays. In the latter case, sub-parameters are treated individually, and the user can control how many of them should be affected. By default, this is set to one sub-parameter only, but it may be changed by invoking setSubParameterWeights(...).

    The proposer relies on a user-defined tuning parameter, which governs the proposal distribution's coefficient of variation (CV). For m = 0, a small epsilon proposal variance is used instead. For bounded domains, v is chosen as if not truncated and sampling is repeated until within the domain.

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

      • NormalProposer

        public NormalProposer(RealParameter param,
              RealInterval interval,
              TuningParameter proposalCV,
              PRNG prng)
        Constructor. Creates a normal proposal distribution.
        Parameters:
        param - state parameter perturbed by this proposer.
        interval - domain of state parameter and proposal distribution.
        proposalCV - tuning parameter governing proposal distribution's CV.
        prng - pseudo-random number generator.

      • NormalProposer

        public NormalProposer(RealParameter param,
              TuningParameter proposalCV,
              PRNG prng)
        Constructor. Creates an unbounded proposal distribution, i.e. defined over (-inf,+inf).
        Parameters:
        param - state parameter perturbed by this proposer.
        proposalCV - tuning parameter governing proposal distribution's CV.
        prng - random number generator.

        Specified by:

      • setSubParameterWeights

        public void setSubParameterWeights(double[] weights)
        For a parameter containing multiple sub-parameters, it is possible to allow for multiple sub-parameters to be changed each proposal. This achieved by specifying a set of weights for the probabilities, e.g. [0.5,0.3,0.1] for perturbing 1 sub-parameter 50% of the time, 2 sub-parameters 30% of the time, and 3 sub-parameters 10% of the time. The sub-parameters are chosen uniformly.
        Parameters:
        weights - the weights.
